mapper.select: SELECT o.uu_id as uuId,o.code,o.parent_code as parentCode,o.type,o.name,o.short_name as shortName, o.other_name as otherName,o.status,o.old_code as oldCode,o.start_date as startDate, o.end_date as endDate,o.old_code_end as oldCodeEnd,o.update_time as updatetime, o.sort,o.org_hierarchy as orghierarchy,o.business_line as businessline,o.secret_level as secretLevel,o.secret_qualifications as secretQualifications,o.org_type as orgType,o.protection_level as protectionLevel, oi.start_ip_num as startIpNum,oi.end_ip_num as endIpNum FROM base_koal_org AS o left join base_org_ip_segment AS oi ON oi.area_code = o.`code` ORDER BY oi.start_ip_num DESC,oi.end_ip_num ASC
SELECT bko.* FROM base_koal_org AS bko INNER JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT(org_code) AS code FROM user) AS bou on bko.`code` = bou.`code`
SELECT bois.* FROM base_org_ip_segment AS bois INNER JOIN base_koal_org AS bko ON bois.area_code = bko.code WHERE bko.org_hierarchy=1

choose.when: select COUNT(*) from user u inner join (select code from base_koal_org where sub_code like CONCAT(#{userQuery.subCode},'%'))b on u.org_code = b.code where u.status <> 2
choose.otherwise: select COUNT(*) from user u where u.status <> 2

choose.when: select COUNT(*) from "user" u inner join (select code from base_koal_org where sub_code like CONCAT(#{userQuery.subCode},'%'))b on u.org_code = b.code where u.status <> 2
choose.otherwise: select COUNT(*) from "user" u where u.status <> 2

mapper.select: select COUNT(*) from user u left join user_ukey uk on u.id = uk.user_id where u.status <> 2
select COUNT(*) from "user" u left join user_ukey uk on u.id = uk.user_id where u.status <> 2
